STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 6, 2024
Tishara Price
Macomb County DHHS
44777 N Gratiot Ave,
Clinton Township, MI, 48036-1362
RE: License#: CP500201269
Dear Ms. Price:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM POLICY 722-08D TREATMENT PLANS – AGREEMENT AND
SIGNATURES
Once completed and approved the caseworker must obtain
signatures from the following individuals, as applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor, when
siblings in care are place apart, parents who are a member
of a participating household. Youth ages 14 and older.
Foster parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated court -
ordered caregivers. Parents/legal guardians, youth, and
caregivers must check yes or no for the following when
signing the treatment plan: I have participated in the
Development of the Case service plan and Parent Agency
Treatment Plan.
Three of eight case records reviewed showed a PATP not obtained within 30 days of
the updated service plans, not signed by the age-appropriate youth and yes or no was
not checked indicating participation with the updated service plan.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2023 Renewal, CAP Approved 8/9/2023

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP submitted was in response to the11/21/2023 interim inspection and the
CAP was approved on 11/29/2023. The CAP addressed 3 violations. There was
improvement with two of the violations that was cited in the 2023 interim
inspection. However, during this licensing period 1 of the violations that was cited
in the 2023 interim inspection is a repeat for this year indicating additional
corrective action planning is needed regarding the repeat violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed with the director. She
reported Macomb has established a training unit to provide the necessary support
for new hires and during this reporting period several vacancies were filled,
however seven new hires left their foster care position creating additional
openings. She reported with the changes in staff there were also issues involving
performance and labor relation issues. The director reported the additional support
and tracking, as it relates to policy and rule compliance and the agency use of the
Outlook calendar and weekly monitoring have been beneficial allowing the agency
to be proactive in any barriers and working through them to align with policy.
Financial Overview
Not Applicable.
Staff Interviews
Three staff members were interviewed on site. Staff report feeling supported by
leadership and coworkers. Staff reported their supervisors are available and

ready to assist as needed. Staff did not report any concerns or areas that could
be approved upon.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing. All files were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
9/6/2024
_________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
9/9/2024

Samantha Way Date
